projects.name: This Site
projects.description: This site is moving into the realm of serverless architecture and JAM concepts. It uses vue-router and axios to load JSON files containing the data for the Vue components. It also calls an external API to validate submitted contact, persist it in an offsite MySql database and send a copy to my Gmail.

projects.name: Laravel58
projects.description: This is a RESTful API for a single noun. Starting small, it's intended to build up feature-by-feature on separate branches, so I can (in theory) pull in a branch containing roughly what I feel is a good starting point for a given project type

projects.name: Graphing
projects.description: Graphs, charts and all things plotty. Current example uses a fixed array of points, but next branch will read JSON from API endpoint(s) and update at regular intervals. Intended for use on dashboards.

projects.name: Mapping
projects.description: Using MapBox and LeafletJS I'm moving from my current use of Google Maps API to this new setup. Along the way I'm hoping to re-explore mapping in a bit more depth (well, distance) from a non-Google perspective

projects.name: PIoT
projects.description: PIoT is an Internet-of-Things project based on the Raspberry Pi's GPIO pins. It uses rudimentary Python & PHP. Early in development, but functional. Backburner stuff.

projects.name: EBook Project
projects.description: The eBook project is an ongoing effort to create an open-source e-book template, however basic, that will satisfy the absolute minimum requirements of most of the major publishing platforms with minimal fuss or setup. Intended as a tool to allow everyone at home write a book.

projects.name: Handy snippets
projects.description: Handy snippets for PHP, JavaScript, Bash, SQL, HTML, CSS and various tools. Only private until it's cleaned up, even vaguely structured and presentable to the World
